text:
Finally, just 33% support single-payer health plan -- the kind advanced by Bernie Sanders and embraced by some 2020 Ds.  But they do believe it's gov't role to guarantee health care availability.

Only group where majority supports single-payer: lib Dems (77%). Only 19% of vote.

text: Where Dems have the edge is making the case that government can do more for the needy (50-43%) advantage.  Solid support for a healthy social safety net, despite the partisan divide.

text:
ICYMI: These are the voters that Schultz would draw from.  A clear 61% majority share his view on wealth creation/the meritocracy -- in the most recent Pew study.

A corrective to the conventional wisdom.

author: HotlineJosh

text:
